name: Perinatal Mental Health Screening Protocol
description: Comprehensive protocol for screening mental health during pregnancy and postpartum, including depression, anxiety, trauma, and psychosocial stressors.

questions.text: Thank you for speaking with me today. Can you tell me a bit about where you are in your pregnancy or postpartum journey?
follow_up_prompts: How are you feeling overall?
What has been on your mind lately?
Is there anything specific you'd like to talk about?

questions.text: How would you describe your mood over the past two weeks?
follow_up_prompts: Have you been feeling down or hopeless?
Do your moods change throughout the day?
Are you experiencing emotional ups and downs?

questions.text: Have you been experiencing worry or anxiety? Can you tell me about that?
follow_up_prompts: What kinds of things worry you?
Do you have racing thoughts?
Does anxiety interfere with your daily activities?

questions.text: How have you been sleeping? Tell me about your sleep patterns.
follow_up_prompts: Are you having trouble falling or staying asleep?
Are you sleeping too much?
Even when you sleep, do you wake up feeling rested?

questions.text: Are you finding interest or pleasure in activities you usually enjoy?
follow_up_prompts: Have you stopped doing things you used to enjoy?
Do you feel motivated to do daily tasks?
How connected do you feel to others?

questions.text: How are your energy levels? Do you feel tired or fatigued?
follow_up_prompts: Is it hard to get through the day?
Do you feel exhausted even after rest?
Are you able to take care of yourself and your baby?

questions.text: How is your ability to concentrate and make decisions?
follow_up_prompts: Do you have trouble focusing?
Is it hard to remember things?
Do you feel confused or overwhelmed by choices?

questions.text: How do you feel about yourself these days?
follow_up_prompts: Do you feel guilty about things?
Do you feel you're a good mother/will be a good mother?
How is your self-confidence?

questions.text: How has your appetite been? Have there been changes in your eating?
follow_up_prompts: Are you eating less or more than usual?
Have you lost or gained weight?
Do you have to force yourself to eat?

questions.text: Sometimes when people feel very low, they have thoughts of harming themselves. Have you had any thoughts like this?
follow_up_prompts: Have you thought about ways you might hurt yourself?
Do you have a plan?
Is there anything keeping you safe right now?

questions.text: Are you experiencing any unwanted or intrusive thoughts?
follow_up_prompts: Do you have repetitive thoughts that upset you?
Do you worry about harm coming to your baby?
Do these thoughts feel out of your control?

questions.text: Have you experienced any traumatic events in the past that affect you now?
follow_up_prompts: Has pregnancy or birth triggered past trauma?
Do you have flashbacks or nightmares?
Have you received support for past trauma?

questions.text: Who can you turn to for emotional support?
follow_up_prompts: Do you feel supported by family and friends?
Is there someone you can talk to about your feelings?
Do you feel alone or isolated?

questions.text: What are the main sources of stress in your life right now?
follow_up_prompts: Are you dealing with financial stress?
Are there relationship problems?
Do you have housing or employment concerns?

questions.text: How do you cope when you're feeling stressed or down?
follow_up_prompts: What helps you feel better?
Do you use alcohol or substances to cope?
Have you tried reaching out for professional help?

questions.text: Have you experienced depression or anxiety before this pregnancy/postpartum period?
follow_up_prompts: Have you received mental health treatment before?
Are you currently taking any psychiatric medications?
What has helped you in the past?

questions.text: Have you discussed your mental health with your healthcare provider?
follow_up_prompts: Were you screened for depression or anxiety?
Did they offer resources or referrals?
Would you be open to mental health support?

questions.text: For those who have delivered: How do you feel about your baby?
follow_up_prompts: Do you feel connected to your baby?
Are you enjoying time with your baby?
Do you have concerns about bonding?

metadata.author: Synthetic Gravidas Research Team
metadata.target_population: Pregnant and postpartum women requiring mental health screening
metadata.note: This protocol screens for depression, anxiety, and related concerns. Positive screens should prompt referral to mental health services.
